Description: Pottery oil-lamp. Mould-made fragment of handle in the form of a palmette. Grey-red Nile silt fabric with mica and white spots. The piece is hollow inside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.76) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2999 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
